I'm trying to do a forward-over-reverse Hessian. The backward pass (Zygote) is going to generate something including an FFT, then the forward needs to work through that. ForwardDiff doesn't seem to support complex numbers so I suppose it can't?
```ForwardDiff.gradient(((A,),) -> real(sum(fft(A*x))), [1]) # error```
Is there anything in Julia that could potentially work?
